title: Highest Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, Yemen's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a significant reliance on international financial support.

title: Rapid Growth in Government Expenditure
description: In 2018, Yemen experienced a 47.24% growth in general government final consumption expenditure, reflecting a substantial increase in government spending.

title: Exceptional Growth in Capital Formation
description: Yemen saw an extraordinary 181.82% growth in both gross fixed capital formation and gross capital formation in 2018, indicating a significant investment in infrastructure and capital goods.

title: High Prevalence of Anemia Among Women
description: In 2019, 61.5% of women of reproductive age in Yemen were affected by anemia, highlighting a critical public health issue.

title: Severe Anemia Among Children
description: In 2019, 79.5% of children aged 6-59 months in Yemen suffered from anemia, indicating a severe nutritional deficiency among the young population.

title: High Rate of Injuries as Cause of Death
description: In 2019, injuries accounted for 19.49% of total deaths in Yemen, reflecting significant safety and health challenges.

title: High Prevalence of Underweight Children
description: In 2022, 40.7% of children under 5 in Yemen were underweight, with a higher prevalence among males (41.7%) than females (39.6%), indicating widespread malnutrition.

title: Complete Binding Coverage for All Products
description: In 2017, Yemen achieved 100% binding coverage for all products, ensuring that all trade tariffs are bound under international agreements.

title: Complete Binding Coverage for Primary Products
description: In 2017, Yemen also secured 100% binding coverage for primary products, reinforcing its commitment to international trade agreements.

title: Dominance of Food Exports
description: In 2019, food exports constituted 99.29% of Yemen's merchandise exports, highlighting the country's reliance on agricultural products for trade.

title: Lowest Energy Consumption Per Capita
description: In 2022, Yemen had one of the lowest energy consumption rates globally, with only 68.95 kg of oil equivalent per capita.

title: Minimal Financial Inclusion Among Young Adults
description: As of 2022, only 5.01% of young adults aged 15-24 in Yemen had an account at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider.

title: Low Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, Yemen had one of the lowest female labor force participation rates, with only 4.907% of women aged 15+ being active in the labor market.

title: Ineffective Government Performance
description: Yemen ranked very low in government effectiveness in 2023, with a percentile rank of 0.47, indicating significant challenges in governance.

title: Poor Quality of Budgetary and Financial Management
description: In 2023, Yemen's CPIA rating for budgetary and financial management was at the lowest possible score of 1, highlighting severe inefficiencies.

title: Gender Equality Challenges
description: Yemen's CPIA gender equality rating was at the lowest score of 1 in 2023, reflecting significant gender disparities.

title: Limited Export to High-Income Economies
description: In 2023, only 0.12% of Yemen's merchandise exports were directed to high-income economies, indicating limited trade diversification.

title: Low Ease of Arranging Competitively Priced Shipments
description: Yemen scored 1.7 on the logistics performance index in 2022, indicating difficulties in arranging competitively priced shipments.

title: Minimal Female Representation in Parliament
description: In 2020, women held only 0.33% of seats in Yemen's national parliament, reflecting minimal female political representation.
